title: Severe Sunburn
summary: Treatment for severe sunburn including sun poisoning symptoms and prevention of complications.

steps.title: Get Out of the Sun
steps.description: Move to a shaded area or indoors immediately. Further sun exposure will worsen the burn. Remove any tight clothing or jewelry before swelling begins.

steps.title: Cool the Skin
steps.description: Take a cool (not cold) bath or shower, or apply cool, damp cloths to burned areas for 10-15 minutes several times a day. Avoid ice or very cold water which can cause additional skin damage.

steps.title: Hydrate Inside and Out
steps.description: Drink plenty of water to prevent dehydration. Sunburn draws fluid to the skin's surface. Apply aloe vera gel or moisturizer to damp skin to lock in moisture. Avoid petroleum-based products which trap heat.

steps.title: Manage Pain and Inflammation
steps.description: Take over-the-counter pain relievers like ibuprofen or aspirin to reduce pain, swelling, and inflammation. Follow package directions. These also help reduce fever if present.

steps.title: Protect Blistered Skin
steps.description: If blisters form, don't pop them - they protect against infection. If blisters break on their own, gently clean with mild soap and water, apply antibiotic ointment, and cover with a loose bandage.

steps.title: Monitor for Sun Poisoning
steps.description: Watch for severe symptoms: fever, chills, nausea, rapid pulse, dizziness, or confusion. These indicate sun poisoning and require medical attention. Continue hydrating and stay in cool environment.

warnings: Severe sunburn in children requires medical evaluation
Do not use benzocaine or lidocaine products - they can cause allergic reactions
Avoid butter, oil, or petroleum jelly on sunburns
Sun-damaged skin is vulnerable to infection
whenToSeekHelp: Blistering over a large area of the body
Fever, chills, or signs of heat exhaustion
Signs of infection: increased pain, pus, red streaks
Severe pain not relieved by over-the-counter medications
preventionTips: Use broad-spectrum sunscreen SPF 30+ and reapply every 2 hours
Wear protective clothing and wide-brimmed hats
Avoid sun exposure between 10 AM and 4 PM
Seek shade, especially during peak sun hours
Remember that water, sand, and snow reflect UV rays
